decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage to clear the path for your creatures and finish off the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with interaction spells like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics while maintaining a fast and aggressive tempo to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to apply pressure early and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using green devotion cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Oath of Nissa, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Old-Growth Troll and Cavalier of Thorns to apply constant pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana generation and powerful threats, supported by cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival to continue building and maintaining board presence. With a strong focus on green mana symbols and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to quickly outpace and outmuscle the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Crumbling Vestige to play Lotus Field. Once Lotus Field is on the battlefield, the player can use cards like Scapeshift and Stock Up to generate a large amount of mana and potentially win the game in one turn by searching for specific lands or combo pieces. The deck also utilizes cards like Lumra, Bellow of the Woods and Thassa's Oracle for additional win conditions or card advantage. The key strategy is to efficiently generate mana to set up explosive plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells. It also utilizes card draw and selection to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an extra element to the deck's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the control elements while also providing consistency. Ultimately, the goal is to outlast opponents while slowly gaining advantage and securing a win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo involving various creatures and spells to generate card advantage, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and control the battlefield. It combines aggressive creatures like Carnage, Crimson Chaos and Rona, Herald of Invasion with disruptive spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to create a versatile game plan. Additionally, cards like Tinybones Joins Up and The Meathook Massacre help to further destabilize the opponent's board state. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression, disruption, and resource manipulation.

This aggressive Jund deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to generate value and inflict direct damage to the opponent. With a combination of sacrifice outlets like Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn, the deck aims to control the battlefield while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Bloodtithe Harvester and The Meathook Massacre to close out games quickly. By leveraging its sacrifice synergies, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in a swift fashion.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays and powerful combos. By ramping up with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods, the deck aims to set up key cards like Scapeshift and Spelunking to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes various utility lands and spells to ensure consistency and protection for the combo, making it a strong and competitive choice for Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt and control the opponent's hand while applying pressure with efficient and evasive creatures. The deck aims to take advantage of discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to strip away the opponent's key cards, while utilizing versatile threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to close out the game quickly. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats, creating a fast-paced and proactive game plan. Additionally, the deck features powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Liliana of the Veil for added late-game power.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field to generate enough resources to cast a game-winning spell like Scapeshift. The deck also focuses on controlling the board with cards like Aftermath Analyst and Conduit Pylons while setting up for a combo finish with Thassa's Oracle or Mirrorpool. The player can disrupt their opponent's game plan with cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Otawara, Soaring City while maintaining card advantage with Stock Up and The Wandering Minstrel. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful finish.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards that can quickly fill up the graveyard with spells, allowing for the Arclight Phoenix to be easily brought back into play. The deck also includes various low-cost spells to deal damage to opponents and control the board, along with card draw spells to keep the hand full. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression, spell recursion, and card advantage to quickly finish the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower. It also utilizes cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Cori-Steel Cutter to support its aggressive strategy. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and control the board with efficient creatures and removal spells, leading to a swift victory through aggressive play and tempo advantage.

The main idea of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck also utilizes creatures with strong abilities like Archfiend of the Dross and Preacher of the Schism to control the board. With a mix of removal, hand disruption, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

A deck focused on ramping up quickly with mana dorks and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to cast powerful green devotion cards such as Cavalier of Thorns and Polukranos Reborn. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and generate value with cards like Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival. The deck also includes some protection with Boseiju, Who Endures and utility creatures like Ulvenwald Oddity. Overall, the strategy revolves around developing a strong board presence and utilizing the synergy of green devotion cards to secure victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on using various cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. It includes cards like Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict for control, along with March of Otherworldly Light and Memory Deluge for card advantage. The deck also includes land destruction with Field of Ruin and a wide range of utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire and Otawara, Soaring City. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional control and card advantage, while Kaheera, the Orphanguard serves as a powerful companion option.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to quickly deal damage. The deck also focuses on card draw and spell cost reduction to maintain a fast pace and keep up pressure. Additionally, the inclusion of counterspells and removal options like Pyroclasm and Reckless Rage allows for disruption of the opponent's game plan while continuing to push for a quick victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap creatures and artifacts to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. By maximizing early game aggression with cards like Novice Inspector and Ornithopter, backed up by removal spells like Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben helps to disrupt the opponent's spells, while Venerated Loxodon and Cosmogrand Zenith provide additional ways to pump up your creatures for a powerful attack.
